required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a regulatory post marketing surveillance in Japan, and it is a local prospective and observational study of patients who have received Zevalin for relapsed or refractory, CD20+, low grade B-cell non-Hodgkin's lymphoma and Mantle cell lymphoma. The objective of this study is to assess safety and efficacy of using Zevalin in clinical practice. This study is also all case investigation of which the enrollment period is five years, and all patients who received Zevalin will be recruited and followed 13 weeks after the administration.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reactions in subjects who received Zevalin
primary_outcome.time_frame: After In-111 Zevalin administration, up to 13 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of serious adverse events, especially secondary malignant tumors, in subjects who received Zevalin
primary_outcome.time_frame: After In-111 Zevalin administration, up to 8 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reactions in subpopulation in a variety of baseline data [such as demographic data, medical history data, clinical staging]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After In-111 Zevalin administration, up to 13 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness evaluation assessment [complete remission rate, complete remission uncertain rate, partial remission rate, stable disease rate, progression disease rate] by investigator-determined overall best response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After In-111 Zevalin administration, up to 13 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness evaluation assessment [progression free survival] by investigator-determined overall best response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After In-111 Zevalin administration, up to 8 years
After In-111 Zevalin administration, up to 13 weeks
After In-111 Zevalin administration, up to 13 weeks
After In-111 Zevalin administration, up to 13 weeks
After In-111 Zevalin administration, up to 13 weeks

intervention.description: Patients who have received Zevalin for relapsed or refractory, CD20+, low grade B-cell non-Hodgkin's lymphoma and Mantle cell lymphoma.

study_pop.textblock: 400cases: This study is all case investigation of which the enrollment period is five years, and all patients who received Zevalin for relapsed or refractory, CD20+, low grade B-cell non-Hodgkin's lymphoma and Mantle cell lymphoma will be recruited.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients who received Zevalin for relapsed or refractory:
- CD20+
- low grade B-cell non-Hodgkin's lymphoma
- Mantle cell lymphoma
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are contraindicated based on the product label
